{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the muscle responsible for the retraction of the mandible. Retraction of the mandible refers to the backward movement of the lower jaw. Among the options, the Temporalis muscle is known to be involved in the retraction of the mandible. The Lateral pterygoid, Medial pterygoid, and Masseter are primarily involved in other movements of the mandible such as elevation, protrusion, and lateral movements.", "answer_choice": "B"}
